sections.title: SPONSORS:
paragraphs: Japanese Society for Artificial Intelligence Support Center for Advanced Telecommunications Technology Research International Communications Foundation Inoue Communications Foundation and Sapporo International Communication Plaza Foundation PROGRAM COMMITTEE: Alexander Rudnicky, Carnegie Mellon University (co-chair) Syun Tutiya, Chiba University (co-chair) Donna Byron (Ohio State University) Phil Cohen (Oregon Health University/OGI) Nils Dahlbeck (Linköpings Universitet) Yasuharu Den (Chiba University) Joakim Gustafson (Telia) Masato Ishizaki (JAIST) Yasuhiro Katagiri (ATR MIC) Masahito Kawamori (Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Company) Andreas Kellner (Philips) Ali Knott (Otago University) Ivana Kruijff-Korbayova (Universität des Saarlandes) Tomoko Kumagai (National Institute for Japanese Language) Alex Lascarides (University of Edinburgh) Lin-Shan Lee (National Taiwan University) Oliver Lemon (Stanford University) Wolfgang Minker (University of Ulm) Mikio Nakano (Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Company) Shrikanth Narayanan (USC) Roberto Pieraccini (SpeechWorks International) Massimo Poesio (University of Edinburgh) Alexandros Potamianos (Technical University of Crete) Norbert Reithinger (DFKI) Laurent Romary (LORIA) Yoshinori Sagisaka (Waseda University) Candace L. Sidner (MERL) Michael Strube (European Media Laboratory) Jan Wiebe (University of Pittsburgh) Bo Xu (Chinese Academy of Science) ORGANIZING COMMITTEE: Akira Kurematsu, University of Electro-Communications (general chair) Alexander Rudnicky, Carnegie Mellon University Syun Tutiya, Chiba University Laila Dybkjær, University of Southern Denmark David Traum, USC Institute for Creative Technologies CONFERENCE WEBSITE: http://www.speech.cs.cmu.edu/sigdial2003/ ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS We would like to thank SIGdial, the Special Interest Group on Discourse and Dialogue, and SLUD, the Special Interest Group on Spoken Language Understanding and Discourse Processing of the Japanese Society for Artificial Intelligence, for providing assistance in the organization of this workshop. We would like to in particular acknowledge the financial support that the Workshop has received from the following organizations: the Japanese Society for Artificial Intelligence, Support Center for Advanced Telecommunications Technology Research, International Communications Foundation, Inoue Communications Foundation and Sapporo International Communication Plaza Foundation. The preparations for the Workshop would have been more difficult without the valuable advice and guidance provided by Laila Dybkjær and David Traum. For this we thank them. We would also like to thank the members of the program committee for their willingness to review papers and to the invited speaker for his participation. Finally, we thank the staffs of the Sapporo Convention Center and the Sapporo Industries Cultivation Center for their special assistance in arranging the meeting place. Akira Kurematsu General Chair Alexander Rudnicky and Syun Tutiya Program Chairs Fourth SIGdial Workshop on Discourse and Dialogue July 2003
